channel.title: Judaism Paganism and Multiculturalism
channel.itunes:description: In a world where paganism was all that people knew, the Jewish concept of monotheism was a stubborn contradiction to all that society stood for. Yet despite all the pressure against it, monotheism refused to disappear. Rabbi Spiro posits a parallel trend today by linking multiculturalism to the steady deterioration of moral values, and presents the surprising position Jews have taken on the subject this time around.
channel.itunes:author: Rabbi Ken Spiro
